00048 #ifndef __CVMX_HELPER_UTIL_H__
00049 #define __CVMX_HELPER_UTIL_H__
00050 
00051 #include "cvmx.h"
00052 #include "cvmx-mio-defs.h"
00053 #include "cvmx-helper.h"
00054 #include "cvmx-fpa.h"
00055 
00056 typedef char cvmx_pknd_t;
00057 typedef char cvmx_bpid_t;
00058 
00059 #define CVMX_INVALID_PKND   ((cvmx_pknd_t) -1)
00060 #define CVMX_INVALID_BPID   ((cvmx_bpid_t) -1)
00061 #define CVMX_MAX_PKND       ((cvmx_pknd_t) 64)
00062 #define CVMX_MAX_BPID       ((cvmx_bpid_t) 64)
00063 
00064 #define CVMX_HELPER_MAX_IFACE       11
00065 #define CVMX_HELPER_MAX_PORTS       16
00066 
00067 
00068 /* Maximum range for normalized (a.k.a. IPD) port numbers (12-bit field) */
00069 #define CVMX_PKO3_IPD_NUM_MAX   0x1000  //FIXME- take it from someplace else ?
00070 #define CVMX_PKO3_DQ_NUM_MAX     0x400  // 78xx has 1024 queues
00071 
00072 #define CVMX_PKO3_IPD_PORT_NULL (CVMX_PKO3_IPD_NUM_MAX-1)
00073 #define CVMX_PKO3_IPD_PORT_LOOP 0
00074 
00075 struct cvmx_xport {
00076     int node;
00077     int port;
00078 };
00079 typedef struct cvmx_xport cvmx_xport_t;
00080 
00081 static inline struct cvmx_xport cvmx_helper_ipd_port_to_xport(int ipd_port)
00082 {
00083     struct cvmx_xport r;
00084     r.port = ipd_port & (CVMX_PKO3_IPD_NUM_MAX - 1);
00085     r.node = (ipd_port >> 12) & CVMX_NODE_MASK;
00086     return r;
00087 }
00088 
00089 static inline int cvmx_helper_node_to_ipd_port(int node, int index)
00090 {
00091     return (node << 12) + index;
00092 }
00093 
00094 struct cvmx_xdq {
00095     int node;
00096     int queue;
00097 };
00098 typedef struct cvmx_xdq cvmx_xdq_t;
00099 
00100 static inline struct cvmx_xdq cvmx_helper_queue_to_xdq(int queue)
00101 {
00102     struct cvmx_xdq r;
00103     r.queue = queue & (CVMX_PKO3_DQ_NUM_MAX - 1);
00104     r.node = (queue >> 10) & CVMX_NODE_MASK;
00105     return r;
00106 }
00107 
00108 static inline int cvmx_helper_node_to_dq(int node, int queue)
00109 {
00110     return (node << 10) + queue;
00111 }
00112 
00113 struct cvmx_xiface {
00114     int node;
00115     int interface;
00116 };
00117 typedef struct cvmx_xiface cvmx_xiface_t;
00118 
00119 /**
00120  * Return node and interface number from XIFACE.
00121  *
00122  * @param xiface interface with node information
00123  *
00124  * @return struct that contains node and interface number.
00125  */
00126 static inline struct cvmx_xiface cvmx_helper_xiface_to_node_interface(int xiface)
00127 {
00128     cvmx_xiface_t interface_node;
00129     /*
00130      * If the majic number 0xde0000 is not present in the
00131      * interface, then assume it is node 0.
00132      */
00133 
00134     if (((xiface >> 0x8) & 0xff) == 0xde) {
00135         interface_node.node = (xiface >> 16) & CVMX_NODE_MASK;
00136         interface_node.interface = xiface & 0xff;
00137     } else {
00138         interface_node.node = cvmx_get_node_num();
00139         interface_node.interface = xiface & 0xff;
00140     }
00141     return interface_node;
00142 }
00143 
00144 /* Used internally only*/
00145 static inline bool __cvmx_helper_xiface_is_null(int xiface)
00146 {
00147     return (xiface & 0xff) == 0xff;
00148 }
00149 
00150 #define __CVMX_XIFACE_NULL 0xff
00151 
00152 /**
00153  * Return interface with majic number and node information (XIFACE)
00154  *
00155  * @param node       node of the interface referred to
00156  * @param interface  interface to use.
00157  *
00158  * @return
00159  */
00160 static inline int cvmx_helper_node_interface_to_xiface(int node, int interface)
00161 {
00162     return ((node & CVMX_NODE_MASK) << 16) | (0xde << 8) | (interface & 0xff);
00163 }
00164 
00165 /**
00166  * Free the pip packet buffers contained in a work queue entry.
00167  * The work queue entry is not freed.
00168  *
00169  * @param work   Work queue entry with packet to free
00170  */
00171 static inline void cvmx_helper_free_pip_pkt_data(cvmx_wqe_t *work)
00172 {
00173     uint64_t        number_buffers;
00174     cvmx_buf_ptr_t  buffer_ptr;
00175     cvmx_buf_ptr_t  next_buffer_ptr;
00176     uint64_t        start_of_buffer;
00177 
00178     number_buffers = work->word2.s.bufs;
00179     if (number_buffers == 0)
00180         return;
00181     buffer_ptr = work->packet_ptr;
00182 
00183     /* Since the number of buffers is not zero, we know this is not a dynamic
00184     short packet. We need to check if it is a packet received with
00185     IPD_CTL_STATUS[NO_WPTR]. If this is true, we need to free all buffers
00186     except for the first one. The caller doesn't expect their WQE pointer
00187     to be freed */
00188     start_of_buffer = ((buffer_ptr.s.addr >> 7) - buffer_ptr.s.back) << 7;
00189     if (cvmx_ptr_to_phys(work) == start_of_buffer)
00190     {
00191         next_buffer_ptr = *(cvmx_buf_ptr_t*)cvmx_phys_to_ptr(buffer_ptr.s.addr - 8);
00192         buffer_ptr = next_buffer_ptr;
00193         number_buffers--;
00194     }
00195 
00196     while (number_buffers--)
00197     {
00198         /* Remember the back pointer is in cache lines, not 64bit words */
00199         start_of_buffer = ((buffer_ptr.s.addr >> 7) - buffer_ptr.s.back) << 7;
00200         /* Read pointer to next buffer before we free the current buffer. */
00201         next_buffer_ptr = *(cvmx_buf_ptr_t*)cvmx_phys_to_ptr(buffer_ptr.s.addr - 8);
00202         cvmx_fpa_free(cvmx_phys_to_ptr(start_of_buffer), buffer_ptr.s.pool, 0);
00203         buffer_ptr = next_buffer_ptr;
00204     }
00205 }
00206 
00207 /**
00208  * Free the pki packet buffers contained in a work queue entry.
00209  * If first packet buffer contains wqe, wqe gets freed too so do not access
00210  * wqe after calling this function.
00211  * This function asssumes that buffers to be freed are from
00212  * Naturally aligned pool/aura.
00213  * It does not use don't write back.
00214  * @param work   Work queue entry with packet to free
00215  */
00216 static inline void cvmx_helper_free_pki_pkt_data(cvmx_wqe_t *work)
00217 {
00218     uint64_t        number_buffers;
00219     uint64_t        start_of_buffer;
00220     cvmx_buf_ptr_pki_t  next_buffer_ptr;
00221     cvmx_buf_ptr_pki_t  buffer_ptr;
00222     cvmx_wqe_78xx_t *wqe = (cvmx_wqe_78xx_t*)work;
00223 
00224     if (!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
00225         return;
00226     }
00227     /* Make sure errata pki-20776 has been applied*/
00228     cvmx_wqe_pki_errata_20776(work);
00229     buffer_ptr = wqe->packet_ptr;
00230     number_buffers = cvmx_wqe_get_bufs(work);
00231 
00232     while (number_buffers--) {
00233         /* FIXME: change WQE function prototype */
00234         unsigned x = cvmx_wqe_get_aura(work);
00235         cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura = __cvmx_fpa3_gaura(x >> 10, x & 0x3ff);
00236         /* XXX- assumes the buffer is cache-line aligned and naturally aligned mode*/
00237         start_of_buffer = (buffer_ptr.addr >> 7) << 7;
00238         /* Read pointer to next buffer before we free the current buffer. */
00239         next_buffer_ptr = *(cvmx_buf_ptr_pki_t *)
00240             cvmx_phys_to_ptr(buffer_ptr.addr - 8);
00241         /* FPA AURA comes from WQE, includes node */
00242         cvmx_fpa3_free(cvmx_phys_to_ptr(start_of_buffer), aura, 0);
00243         buffer_ptr = next_buffer_ptr;
00244     }
00245 }
00246 
00247 /**
00248  * Free the pki wqe entry buffer.
00249  * If wqe buffers contains first packet buffer, wqe does not get freed here.
00250  * This function asssumes that buffers to be freed are from
00251  * Naturally aligned pool/aura.
00252  * It does not use don't write back.
00253  * @param work   Work queue entry to free
00254  */
00255 static inline void cvmx_wqe_pki_free(cvmx_wqe_t *work)
00256 {
00257     cvmx_wqe_78xx_t *wqe = (cvmx_wqe_78xx_t *)work;
00258     unsigned x;
00259     cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura;
00260 
00261     if (!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
00262         return;
00263     }
00264     /* Do nothing if the first packet buffer shares WQE buffer */
00265     if (!wqe->packet_ptr.packet_outside_wqe)
00266         return;
00267 
00268     /* FIXME change WQE function prototype */
00269     x = cvmx_wqe_get_aura(work);
00270     aura = __cvmx_fpa3_gaura(x >> 10, x & 0x3ff);
00271 
00272     cvmx_fpa3_free(work, aura, 0);
00273 }

00325  * Returns the IPD port number for a port on the given
00326  * interface.

00328  * @param interface Interface to use

00335 /**
00336  * Returns the PKO port number for a port on the given interface,
00337  * This is the base pko_port for o68 and ipd_port for older models.
00338  *
00339  * @param interface Interface to use
00340  * @param port      Port on the interface
00341  *
00342  * @return PKO port number and -1 on error.
00343  */
00344 extern int cvmx_helper_get_pko_port(int interface, int port);
00345 
00346 /**
00347  * Returns the IPD/PKO port number for the first port on the given
00348  * interface.
00349  *
00350  * @param interface Interface to use
00351  *
00352  * @return IPD/PKO port number
00353  */
00354 static inline int cvmx_helper_get_first_ipd_port(int interface)
00355 {
00356     return cvmx_helper_get_ipd_port(interface, 0);
00357 }
00358 
00359 /**
00360  * Returns the IPD/PKO port number for the last port on the given
00361  * interface.
00362  *
00363  * @param interface Interface to use
00364  *
00365  * @return IPD/PKO port number
00366  *
00367  * Note: for o68, the last ipd port on an interface does not always equal to
00368  * the first plus the number of ports as the ipd ports are not contiguous in
00369  * some cases, e.g., SGMII.
00370  *
00371  * Note: code that makes the assumption of contiguous ipd port numbers needs to
00372  * be aware of this.
00373  */
00374 static inline int cvmx_helper_get_last_ipd_port(int interface)
00375 {
00376     extern int cvmx_helper_ports_on_interface(int interface);
00377 
00378     return cvmx_helper_get_ipd_port(interface,
00379         cvmx_helper_ports_on_interface(interface) - 1);
00380 }
00381 
00382 /**
00383  * Free the packet buffers contained in a work queue entry.
00384  * The work queue entry is not freed.
00385  * Note that this function will not free the work queue entry
00386  * even if it contains a non-redundant data packet, and hence
00387  * it is not really comparable to how the PKO would free a packet
00388  * buffers if requested.
00389  *
00390  * @param work   Work queue entry with packet to free
00391  */
00392 void cvmx_helper_free_packet_data(cvmx_wqe_t *work);
